tool_description: This code sets up a web server that, upon receiving a GET request with an exchange name and page range, scrapes CoinDesk for cryptocurrency exchange data within that range and returns the extracted data which is CoinDesk News as a JSON response.
name: CoinDesk News API
title: CoinDesk News API

api_list.name: Bitcoin - Page 31 and Page 36
api_list.description:
The route pattern is specified as '/:exchange/:pageRange', where ':exchange' and ':pageRange' are placeholders for dynamic values that will be extracted from the request URL.
Based on the URL, the value of ":exchange" will be "bitcoin" and the value of ":pageRange" will be "31-36". These values are extracted from the URL and stored in the variables exchange and pageRange, respectively.
The server would likely scrape the CoinDesk website for data related to the "ether" exchange, specifically within the page range from 2 to 8. The scraped data would then be serialized as JSON and sent back as a response to the client.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://coindesk-news-api1.p.rapidapi.com/bitcoin/31-36"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "coindesk-news-api1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Ether - Page 2 and Page 8
api_list.description:
The route pattern is specified as '/:exchange/:pageRange', where ':exchange' and ':pageRange' are placeholders for dynamic values that will be extracted from the request URL.
Based on the URL, the value of ":exchange" will be "ether" and the value of ":pageRange" will be "2-8". These values are extracted from the URL and stored in the variables exchange and pageRange, respectively.
The server would likely scrape the CoinDesk website for data related to the "ether" exchange, specifically within the page range from 2 to 8. The scraped data would then be serialized as JSON and sent back as a response to the client.

            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",

print(response.json())
